image-wrap.label: Figure 1
image-wrap.caption: Map of Great Burgan Field, South East Kuwait [Source: Geoexpro, 2010 ]

formatted-caption.caption-text: Map of Great Burgan Field, South East Kuwait [Source: Geoexpro, 2010 ]

linkTarget.anchoringText: The new Burgan wells profiles are targeting deeper formation, where as the previous majority targeted a shallower formation. Hence, hole sections will be drilled deeper, including the 16 inch intermediate hole section (Figure 2). Moreover, the well profiles will be changed from vertical to slanted profiles. This requires the 16 inch hole to be drilled with a directional assembly.

image-wrap.label: Figure 2
image-wrap.caption: New 16" Section Lithology and Standard 12 ¼" Section Lithology

formatted-caption.caption-text: New 16" Section Lithology and Standard 12 ¼" Section Lithology

linkTarget.anchoringText: The torque range required to drill with a PDC is higher than that for a roller cone bit. Large diameter PDC bits tend to generate high drilling vibrations and stabilizing the BHA becomes increasingly challenging. Figure 3 shows plotted results for torque ranges and fluctuations in a drilling simulation lab. The experiment conducted illustrates that when drilling through inter-bedded formations, at constant WOB and RPM, Torque fluctuations are a function of bit type. Roller cone tend to provide the least torque fluctuations in comparison to PDC and hybrid bits, as per the simulation lab results.

image-wrap.label: Figure 3
image-wrap.caption: Lab Simulation for Torque Ranges and Fluctuations – by drill bit Type

formatted-caption.caption-text: Lab Simulation for Torque Ranges and Fluctuations – by drill bit Type

linkTarget.anchoringText: Multiple factors were considered in the selection of the most applicable hybrid design, shown on Figure 4. The following were the main considerations made:

image-wrap.label: Figure 4
image-wrap.caption: 16 inch Hybrid Bit Design Selected for Well 4

formatted-caption.caption-text: 16 inch Hybrid Bit Design Selected for Well 4

linkTarget.anchoringText: The chart (figure 5) summarizes the 16 inch section drilling days of South East Kuwait directional application; showing the improvement in ROP hybrid [Blue line] has delivered compared to roller cone average performance [black line].

image-wrap.label: Figure 5
image-wrap.caption: South East Kuwait 16 inch Drilling Days Chart [Roller cone versus optimized hybrid]

formatted-caption.caption-text: South East Kuwait 16 inch Drilling Days Chart [Roller cone versus optimized hybrid]

linkTarget.anchoringText: A specific cost per foot comparison was conducted for Well 1 and Well 4, since both wells were drilled by the same rig. Thus their study would be a fair cost comparison. Cost per foot was reduced from $260/ft to $124/ft in Well 4, by hybrid drill bit, in comparison to conventional roller cone offset in Well 1 (Figure 6).
